RecitationInstruction.ab: yaϑā ahū vairiiō IV gwptn'] 5, 6, 15, 40, 88; ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō IV 100, 110, 231, 234, 235; ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō aϑā ratuš aṣ̌āt̰.cīt̰ hacā wycst' cslwšʾmywtyk (400 wycyst' cslyšʾmlwtyk) gwbšn' 400, 410, 500, 510; ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō chl bʾl gwptn' 672.

Nerangs.ab: yaϑā ahū vairiiō čahār guftan pad harw š́iiaōϑananąm grih ī barsom ǰumbēnīdan rāspīg bōy ō ī ātaxš dahišn abāg zōt bē gōwišn aṣ̌əm. vohū. sē

"They should recite four yaθā ahū vairiiō. At each š́iiaōϑananąm, he (the zōt) shoud move the knots of the barsom and the rāspīg has to give bōy to the fire and recite together with the zōt three aṣ̌əm vohū."
yaϑā ahū vairiiō čahār guftan pad harw š́iiaōϑananąm grih ī barsom ǰumbēnīdan
"They should recite four Ahuna Vairiia. At each š́iiaōϑananąm, he (the zōt) should move the knots of the barsom."

Quotations.ab: pad ān čahār yatāhūwēryō pad š́iiaoθananąm ī fradom andak-ē grih be sōhišn u-š pas tā ō sastica be hilišn ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay xwad-iš tā ō sastica bē hilišn

During the four Yatāhuwayryō he should touch the grih a little at the first š́iiaoθananąm, and then he should let go of it by the time he reaches sastica. There is one who says: "He should certainly let go of it by the time he reaches sastica."

ab.ab: "Out of these above 4 Ahuna Vairiia, while reciting 2 Ahuna Vairiia, the chief priest with the right hand, holding both ends of the date-palm leaf of the bundle, ties two front knots like the girdle, from the middle outside the moon-shaped stand, then he goes on reciting the two remaining Ahuna Vairiia"

"While reciting the first two y. a. v., the zōt ties, with his right hand, the ends of the woven date-palm leaf together with two knots, one for each y. a. v., tightening each knot with the word 'actions' (shyaothnanām), and creating a loop with the cord. Throughout, the priest's left hand remains in continuous contact with the barsom.
